So, I've always been fascinated by Hagrid's unique heritage. As a half-giant, he's got this incredible mix of magical and non-magical bloodlines that make him who he is. capsules_submitted.utterance: So I've been thinking about Hagrid's role as the gamekeeper and Care of Magical Creatures teacher at Hogwarts. He's essentially the guardian of the school's magical creatures and the grounds themselves. That's a pretty important responsibility, especially considering the dangers that come with handling those creatures. I'm quite certain that Hagrid takes his job very seriously and is always looking out for the well-being of both the students and the creatures in his care.
